meanings.definition: To clean or clear a surface with a broom or brush.
meanings.sent1: I will sweep the floor after dinner.
meanings.sent2: She likes to sweep the porch every morning.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to help me sweep, but ended up playing with the broom.
meanings.sent4: His speech seemed to sweep away all doubts and fears.
meanings.sent5: The wind began to sweep the fallen leaves across the yard.

meanings.definition: To move swiftly and smoothly in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The dancer will sweep across the stage gracefully.
meanings.sent2: The clouds seemed to sweep across the sky on a windy day.
meanings.sent3: The superhero can sweep in and save the day in an instant.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to sweep through the room, leaving everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The river will sweep around the bend and continue its journey.
